title.text: Building My Personal Website with Next.js and Prismic

excerpt.text: How I built this personal website using modern web technologies including Next.js 16, Prismic CMS, and Tailwind CSS.

content.text: I recently decided to build a new personal website to showcase my projects and share my thoughts on web development. I wanted something modern, fast, and easy to maintain, so I chose Next.js 16 with Prismic CMS.

Next.js provides excellent developer experience with server components, automatic optimization, and great performance out of the box. The app router makes routing intuitive and the ecosystem is fantastic.

excerpt.text: My experience setting up Prismic for content management and why I chose it for my personal site.

content.text: As a developer, I wanted a content management system that would be easy to use but also powerful enough to handle different content types. Prismic has been perfect for my personal website needs.

The slice machine in Prismic allows me to create reusable content components that I can mix and match to create rich, flexible page layouts. This has been a game-changer for how I structure my content.

excerpt.text: The tools and processes I use daily as a web developer to stay productive and write quality code.

content.text: Over the years, I've refined my development workflow to maximize productivity and code quality. Here are the tools and processes that work best for me in 2024.
For most projects, I use TypeScript, React/Next.js, and Tailwind CSS. This combination gives me type safety, excellent developer experience, and rapid development capabilities.

excerpt.text: Learn how to build modern web applications with Next.js 16, including server components, app router, and the latest features.

content.text: Next.js 16 brings exciting new features that make building web applications easier and more performant. In this post, we'll explore the key improvements and how you can leverage them in your projects.
One of the biggest changes in Next.js 16 is the shift to server components by default. This means your components now run on the server, providing better performance and security out of the box.

excerpt.text: A complete guide to setting up Prismic CMS with your Next.js application for content management.

content.text: Prismic offers a powerful headless CMS solution that integrates seamlessly with Next.js. Let's walk through the setup process and best practices.
First, create a new repository in Prismic and configure your custom types. This will define the structure of your content and how it should be organized.

excerpt.text: Modern approaches to creating responsive web designs that work seamlessly across all devices.

content.text: Responsive design is more important than ever in 2024. With the variety of devices and screen sizes available, creating designs that adapt well is crucial for user experience.
Start your design process with mobile in mind. This approach ensures your content is accessible and usable on the smallest screens before scaling up.
